result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ryan W. Hilgart was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan W. Hilgart in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Advised of rights/penalties.  NG plea by court.    Defense/DE waives preliminary hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Ryan W. Hilgart in court with Attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, and waives reading of complaint.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.

John Yackel appeared on behalf of the State.  DE appeared via video means, in custody, with Attorney Thomas W. Duffy.

Court set $1,000 cash bond, with conditions: 

SPECIAL BOND Conditions for Operating While Intoxicated
1. Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of Logger's Mill, only in the kitchen, for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the DAILY testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
4.  May not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
5.  May not drive without a valid driver's license.
